attributes.action: Make manufacturers use appropriate packaging and to drop plans to make end users pay a "bin tax"
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
As consumers, we have no control over the packaging used by manufacturers. If a certain level of functionality is required and "Product X" is the only one to fulfil those requirements, no-one is going to put up with an inferior product just because it is more eco-friendly packaged.

An example of this is computer software on CD coming in a box as big as a family-sized Cornflakes pack, or a magnifying glass measuring 3"x2" coming in a hard plastic pack of 9"x6"

Yet the government want to make us consumers pay yet more money - over and above our ever-increasing council tax - for disposing of our refuse by way of a "pay as you throw, bin tax".

It is grossly unfair and a problem that should be solved at source, not by yet more taxation of people who have no control over it and cannot do anything about it.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
